citations.narrative:
***On March 20, 2023, a male Bobcat escaped his enclosure. He was successfully sedated by the Attending Veterinarian
and taken to the clinic for recovery within an hour and five minutes of escape. There were no injuries to the Bobcat, the
public or the staff members. The Bobcat was fully recovered at the time of inspection. The enclosure had been
constructed of 2"x 4" horse wire with solid fiberglass panels covering the wire on the outside of the building. In the alley
way of the housing unit, a hole was found at the bottom of the wire by staff members. This area has since been repaired.
The entire back wall of horse wire has been replaced with 2" x 4" horse panels with the solid fiberglass panels reattached.
Other areas of the entire enclosure have been updated to ensure strength and containment.
Escape of animals can cause injury to the animals, public or staff members.
The licensee must ensure that all enclosures are structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals
from injury and contain the animals as required.
Corrected March 20-21, 2023 and must continue from this correction date.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the curator.
End Section

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
***On March 20, 2023, a male Bobcat escaped his enclosure. He was successfully sedated by the Attending Veterinarian 
and taken to the clinic for recovery within an hour and five minutes of escape. There were no injuries to the Bobcat, the 
public or the staff members. The Bobcat was   fully recovered at the time of inspection. The enclosure had been 
constructed of 2"x 4" horse wire with solid fiberglass panels covering the wire on the outside of the building. In the alley 
way of the housing unit, a hole was found at the bottom of the wire by staff members. This area has since been repaired. 
The entire back wall of horse wire has been replaced with 2" x 4" horse panels with the solid fiberglass panels reattached. 
Other areas of the entire enclosure have been updated to ensure strength and containment.  
Escape of animals can cause injury to the animals, public or staff members.  
The licensee must ensure that all enclosures are structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals 
from injury and contain the animals as required.  
Corrected March 20-21, 2023 and must continue from this correction date. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the curator. 
 
End Section

species.common: JAMAICAN FRUIT-EATING BAT / JAMAICAN FRUIT BAT
